definition: to draw back/to move back and forth/to hesitate/in an instant
to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
to hesitate to move forward/to balk/to jib

sentences.english: Only empty heads and empty hearts can do that.
sentences.chinese: 让人逡巡徘徊的只能是思想空洞和心灵空虚。

sentences.english: The depths of winter; the wolf stalks his prey by night; red blood on white snow.
sentences.chinese: 彻寒见深冬，孤狼逡巡忽有获，雪岭今血红。

sentences.english: The burro balked at climbing the path.
sentences.chinese: 小毛驴逡巡着不肯爬上小路。

sentences.english: And many of them balk when presented with commercial software.
sentences.chinese: 他们中许多在商业软件前逡巡不前。

sentences.english: Local lore has it that a white-bearded old man seen frequently wandering there was the god of this tree.
sentences.chinese: 地方传说有一白须长者，常见逡巡周围，实是树神。

sentences.english: Two suspicious-looking fellows were seen hanging around the campus last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜有人看见两个形迹可疑的人在校园里逡巡。

sentences.english: The cat prowled around the cellar looking for mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫在地窖里四处逡巡抓耗子。

sentences.english: The horse balked at the high fence.
sentences.chinese: 马在高栅栏前逡巡不前。

sentences.english: The balky horse refused the jump.
sentences.chinese: 马逡巡不前拒绝跳过去。

sentences.english: How often I find myself standing and looking at it where it flits.
sentences.chinese: 我常发现自己呆立着看它逡巡飞舞。

definition: to wander/to shift around/to waver/to vacillate
to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to tread/to tramp/to loiter/to hover around
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
glancing to left and right (idiom); to look all around
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
